page.title: 16SIDDINGTON'S SCHOOL
page.content: Siddington's Church of England Primary School is 2km SSE of Cirencester.A 100 years ago a church was demolished and the school built of the stone.Glos. County Council pay for all repairs,but the school has to supply the materials There are 5 teachers,one a remedial teacher,a cook and a cleaner.There are 91 children aged 4 to 11 in 4 classes. Many children cycle to school because of its isolated site.They attend from 9 am to 3.45 pm.There is a reserve in the grounds which is used for nature study.In the winter boys play football and girls play netball.In summer boys and girls do athletics.Music,sport,art and craft are the children's favourite subjects.The local Vicar,Rev.P.Sudbury takes a close interest in the school and is chairman of the Governors.
